issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares Farm.addAnimal(animal: Animal):boolean (i.e., it returns a boolean), but the reference solution implements addAnimal(Animal) with a void return type. The template Main usage (commented example) also calls addAnimal(...) without using a return value, which implies a void return. This mismatch between the UML and the actual/expected method signature can confuse students about the correct return type to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the signature: either change the UML in the problem statement to show addAnimal(animal: Animal):void (preferred, since example usage does not expect a return value), or update the template and solution to have addAnimal return boolean and adjust example usage accordingly. Prefer updating the UML/problem statement to void to match the template example and the solution implementation.
